name: 黃柏鈞
objective:
This course overviews discrete mathematics and discusses their roles in modern computation. We expect that students can utilize what they have learned in this course to further explore many advanced areas in computer science.

NOTE: This course will be mostly given in English. All materials will be given in English. Students must have their own copy of textbook No. 1 to well participate this course.
schedule:
1. Logic and Proofs
2. Sets, Functions, Sequences, Sums, and Matrices
3. Algorithms
4. Elementary Number Theory and Cryptography
5. Induction and Recursion
6. Counting
7. Discrete Probability
8. Advanced Counting Techniques
9. Relations
10. Graphs
11. Trees
12. Boolean Algebra
13. Finite state machines and formal languages
14. Concrete mathematics
scorePolicy:
Midterm exam: 25%
Final exam: 25%
Quiz: 10~20%
Homework assignments: 10~20%
In-class participation: 20%
materials:
1. Kenneth H. Rosen, Discrete Mathematics and Its Applications, 7th Edition, McGraw-Hill, 2012. (Or its subsequent editions.)
2. Ronald L. Graham et al., Concrete Mathematics, 2nd Edition, Addison-Wesley Publishing Company, 1993.
